result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R. Elliott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas R. Elliott in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead as charged for a costs-only disposition.  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Costs - $443 - 60 dtp.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court, by authorization, for Defendant Nicholas R. Elliott. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nicholas R. Elliott not in court.  Atty. M enters NG plea on def's behalf.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas R. Elliott in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court instructs def to contact SPD re eligibility.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
